name: Galmar Stone-Fist
location: Palace of the Kings, Windhelm / Stormcloak command posts
role: Housecarl to Ulfric Stormcloak and Chief Military Strategist

aspects.high_concept: Ulfric's Trusted War Chief and Stone-Fisted Strategist
aspects.trouble: My Hatred for the Empire Blinds Me
other_aspects: The Old Ways Are the True Ways

stunts: Stone-Fist Crush: When using bare hands or gauntlets, +2 to Fight and can create situational aspects like 'Broken Bones' or 'Dazed'
Master Tactician: +2 to Tactics when planning military operations or reading battlefield situations
Rally the Rebellion: Once per scene, grant all allied Stormcloaks in the zone +2 to their next action through a rousing war cry
Great War Veteran: Because of extensive combat experience, gain +1 to Fight when leading troops and can ignore first mild consequence per session
True Nord's Fury: When fighting Imperials or Thalmor, invoke 'Skyrim Belongs to the Nords' for free once per scene

equipment.special: Ulfric's seal of authority, battle maps

personality_notes.speaking_style: Gruff, direct, uses military terms. Respectful to Ulfric but blunt with everyone else. Dismissive of Imperial 'softness' and political maneuvering.
motivations: Restore traditional Nord values and Talos worship
fears: Ulfric being wrong about the rebellion
Skyrim becoming weak without the Empire's protection
His hatred leading Skyrim to ruin
quirks: Tests warrior NPCs with physical challenges

relationships.General Tullius: Imperial tyrant who must be defeated
relationships.Thalmor: Hated enemies who destroyed the Empire
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Disappointed in his neutrality, wants him as ally
relationships.Brunwulf Free-Winter: Views him with suspicion as an 'Imperial lover' who undermines Ulfric
relationships.The Player: Respects as warrior, wants allegiance for Stormcloaks

trust_benefits.3: Galmar respects you as a warrior
trust_benefits.5: Galmar shares tactical intelligence and gives you command roles
trust_benefits.7: Galmar considers you Ulfric's finest champion and trusts you with critical missions
trust_benefits.8: Galmar would follow you into Oblivion itself

combat_tactics: Galmar fights on the front lines, leading by example. He uses his stone-fist technique to break enemy morale and formations. Prefers direct confrontation over stealth or subterfuge. Will sacrifice himself to save Ulfric. Commands troops with efficient, brutal tactics learned from the Great War.
dialogue_examples: The Empire's nothing but a shell. The Thalmor are calling the shots now.
Ulfric is the true High King. What right does the Empire have to say otherwise?
You got some stones showing up here. You looking to fight for Skyrim's freedom, or are you another milk-drinking Imperial?
We will win this war. We will drive the Empire from our lands and reclaim what is ours!
I've fought enough battles to know when we've got the advantage. And we do.

questline_role.civil_war_stormcloak: Primary quest giver and military commander

branching_interactions.if_imperial: Becomes sworn enemy, will personally lead forces against party
branching_interactions.if_stormcloak: Becomes mentor and ally, opens up strategic missions
branching_interactions.if_neutral: Pressures party to join, sees neutrality as cowardice
branching_interactions.if_renowned: Respects martial prowess but insists warriors must choose a side

story_hooks: Galmar has history with Legate Rikke - they fought together in the Great War
He is absolutely loyal to Ulfric but sometimes questions tactics privately
Deeply traditional Nord - suspicious of anything non-Nord
His stone-fist technique is legendary among Stormcloaks
May reveal doubts about the rebellion in private moments of vulnerability
gm_notes:
Galmar is the heart of the Stormcloak military. Unlike Ulfric who has political motivations, Galmar is purely focused on freeing Skyrim through force. He represents the traditional Nord warrior culture. Can be used to show the costs of war and the complexity of the rebellion - he's not evil, just deeply committed to his cause. His relationship with Rikke adds tragedy to the civil war.
WHT-10: SEEING STARS applied (2 free invokes against Galmar). Spent 1 FP to invoke Veteran of the Great War on an attack.

loot_if_defeated.campaign_impact: Defeating Galmar is a major blow to Stormcloak morale and military efficiency

alternatives_to_combat.negotiation: Very difficult unless Ulfric is somehow convinced. Galmar follows Ulfric's lead absolutely.
alternatives_to_combat.intimidation: Respects strength but will never back down from a worthy fight
alternatives_to_combat.deception: Galmar is straightforward and direct - hard to deceive but not impossible with good lies about Imperial treachery
